text:
Nawab Banoo (18 February 1933 – 25 March 2020), better known by her stage name Nimmi, was an Indian actress. Nimmi was born in Agra, United Provinces of Agra and Oudh, British India, (present-day Uttar Pradesh, India).
She became known in the 1950s and early 1960s in Hindi movies. Her best roles were in "Sazaa" (1951), "Aan" (1952), "Uran Khatola" (1955), "Bhai-Bhai" (1956), "Kundan" (1955), "Mere Mehboob" (1963), "Pooja Ke Phool" (1964), "Akashdeep" (1965), and "Love and God" (1986).
Nimmi died on 25 March 2020 at her home in Mumbai of a heart attack at the age of 87.

annotations.surface_form: United Provinces of Agra and Oudh
